newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Good sentiment to boost Singapore share market.
newsitem.headline: Good sentiment to boost Singapore share market.

text.p: The run-up in Singapore shares over the last few days was likely to continue till early next week, dealers said on Friday.
They said the recent spate of buying from European funds had spurred the Singapore market despite Wall Street's marginal downturn over the last two days.
On Thursday, the key Straits Times Industrials Index (STII) closed at 2,206.09, up 23.78 points. Dealers expected the index to test the next resistance level at 2,250 in the near term.
Wall Street closed at 5,867.74, down 9.62 points overnight. --Seah Beng Nah, Singapore newsroom (65 8703080)
